intro: Astripomoea longituba, commonly known as the long-stemmed morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that open in the early morning. The plant belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many species of morning glories. Its leaves are heart-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while the flowers range in color from white to pale blue. Astripomoea longituba is typically found in moist, shaded environments and is valued for its ornamental appeal.
